page.title: 16Hyssington Village Hall
page.content: The village hall was built of timber, asbestos and corrugated iron in 1921 - a gift of the{Davies Trust of {Llandinam.}Affairs are managed by three trustees and a committee of officers and representatives of every organization in the Village which uses the Hall who meet every two months. Monthly{whist drives}are held form September to June.{Women's Institute meets monthly. The{Airgun Clubs}meet weekly from September to April. The {C.A.D.S (Drama)}use it occasionally for rehearsals.{Church}and{Chapel}make occasional use for sales, services and meetings.{Annual harvest supper}is held in October and{Sports}day in August. It is also used for{Bonfire Night and the{New Year Social . In 1985 the Hall was{completely {decorated}inside and out at a total cost of Â£1025 .
